intro: Calcitrapa angusticeps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calcitrapa, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
